definitions.definition: The ethical or moral sense of right and wrong , chiefly as it affects a person’s own behaviour and forms their attitude to their past actions.
examples: Your conscience is your highest authority.

definitions.definition: A personification of the moral sense of right and wrong, usually in the form of a person , a being or merely a voice that gives moral lessons and advices.

main_definition: The ethical or moral sense of right and wrong , chiefly as it affects a person’s own behaviour and forms their attitude to their past actions.
secondary_definitions: ( chiefly fiction , narratology ) A personification of the moral sense of right and wrong, usually in the form of a person , a being or merely a voice that gives moral lessons and advices.
( obsolete ) Consciousness ; thinking ; awareness , especially self-awareness .
